intro: Columnea lanata var. coccinea, commonly known as the red-hair or red-flowered candelabra plant, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is characterized by its striking, tubular red flowers that bloom in clusters, often resembling candles, hence its common name. The plant has velvety, hairy leaves that give it a distinctive texture and appearance. It thrives in warm, humid environments and is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its vibrant blooms. Columnea lanata var. coccinea is a member of the Gesneriaceae family, which includes many ornamental and horticultural species.
